qas.question: On what major line of latitude is the Congo located?

context: Since <b8_0>the country<b8_0/> is <b4_0>located on the <a0_0>Equator<b4_0/><a0_0/>, the climate is consistent year-round, with the average day temperature being a humid <a1_0><b5_0>24 °C (75 °F)<b5_0/><a1_0/> and nights generally between <a2_0>16 °C (61 °F) and 21 °C (70 °F)<a2_0/>. The average yearly rainfall ranges from 1,100 millimetres (43 in) in south in the Niari Valley to over <b6_0>2,000 millimetres (79 in)<b6_0/> in central parts of the country. The dry season is from <a3_0>June to August<a3_0/> while in the majority of the country the wet season has <b7_0>two<b7_0/> rainfall maxima: one in March–May and another in September–November.
